page.title: 04LANGENHOE HALL AND CHURCH
page.content:
There are two houses in the area close together. One of them is called {Langenhoe Rectory.}The other one is called{Langenhoe Hall.}They were built in the 18th century. They are old, big and strong houses.
There has been a farm and house on the same site for hundreds of years. The farm is mentioned in the first Domesday Book.
Next to{Langenhoe Hall}is where {Langenhoe Church}used to be. It was first built in the 11th century and was badly damaged in the{Essex {Earthquake}in 1884. It was finally demolished in 1961,and{Langenhoe people now have to go to{Abberton {Church.
